page.title: 14THE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The sewage works,just to the south of the {West End of Clevedon}was opened in 1973 by Sir John Vernon Wills. The{Kingston Seymour}works is in the Somerset division of sewage works. It was built for Long Ashton Rural District Council. It takes sewage from Clevedon ,Portishead,Weston,Long Ashton, Tickenham and neighbouring villages. There is 50 miles of pipeline at the works but the chemical treatment plant has been shut down because of cost. As the population grows and more water is used there is obviously more dirty water to be cleaned before it can be returned to the water courses. In the future there will be more re-use of water so it is important to understand how used water can be treated to avoid pollution.
